summary: This document consists of three consecutive daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, covering August 9-10, 2019. The logs detail routine operations and counts, but the final entry on August 10 records the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell.

persons.name: Felix
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 85775-054, listed as being on psychological observation or suicide watch with an inmate companion in the facility logs.

persons.name: Williams
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 478640-054 (also listed as 78640-054), listed as being on psychological observation or suicide watch with an inmate companion in the facility logs.

persons.name: Gentile
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 471230-054 (also listed as 71230-054), consistently listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion across the logs.

persons.name: Ramos
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 485428-054 (also listed as 85428-054), consistently listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion across the logs.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 486624-054 (also listed as 86824-054), listed as being held in a dry cell under staff watch. Transferred to special housing (dry cell) on August 9.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 76318-054. The log for August 10, 2019, records that he was found unresponsive in cell 206-220 in Unit 9 South at 6:33 AM. CPR was performed, EMS was called, and he was transported to a local hospital.

persons.name: Mutimura
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 76329-054, logged as being processed during the institutional count on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Carreon-Macias
persons.context: Inmate with registration number 82858-198, logged as being released on bail on August 9, 2019, resulting in a count adjustment.

persons.name: M. Cannata
persons.context: An operations lieutenant who relieved the day watch lieutenant of duties on August 9, 2019, at 4:00 PM.

connections.description: Both inmates were on psychological observation/suicide watch and were transferred to special housing together on the evening of August 10, 2019.
Both inmates were consistently listed together as being on psychological observation with inmate companions across the three log entries.

events.title: Routine Jail Operations and Inmate Transfer
events.description: Standard daily operations at MCC New York, including counts, equipment checks, and the transfer of inmate Fernandez to a dry cell in special housing.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (206-220, Unit 9 South). CPR was initiated, 911 was called at 6:35 AM, EMS arrived at 6:43 AM, and he was transported to a local hospital at 7:10 AM while CPR continued.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at 6:33 AM on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
The log entry states CPR was in progress immediately after he was found, and EMS was notified at 6:35 AM.
Epstein was transported via ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10 AM, with CPR still in progress by EMTs.
The logs show several other inmates (Felix, Williams, Gentile, Ramos, Fernandez) were under special psychological observation or in dry cells in the days surrounding Epstein's death.
The document is an official, chronological record of facility operations leading up to and including the moment Epstein was discovered in medical distress.
